timeline.bodyText: The ALogger in this case will wind up going to stdout whereas LogManager.getLogger won't.  I'd be tempted to remove the ALogger from here and always use Log4J directly but then edit the default log4j.xml to send logs from this class to stdout. Or if you prefer, add a method to ALogger so that it can print exception stack traces and stick with using it.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Added some ALogger methods that accept exceptions.

timeline.bodyText: Note that this will print the exception message, but not the full stack trace. Not sure if that's what you wanted or not.  You can't use placeholders and get a full stack trace.
